qas.question: What FBI agent was killed during attacks on the World Trade Center?
What tower was Leonard W. Hatton Jr attempting to evacuate?
What did the FBI's new director want?
What was the new head of the FBI's top priority?
What part of the FBI did Mueller want to re-engineer?

What was Hatton trying to do in the North Tower of the World Trade Center?
Who was sworn in as FBI Director a week after the attacks?
What was a low priority for Mueller?
What did Mueller not try to protect?

context: During the September 11, 2001 attacks on the World Trade Center, FBI agent <a0_0><b5_0>Leonard W. Hatton Jr<a0_0/>.<b5_0/> was killed during the rescue effort while <b6_0>helping the rescue personnel<b6_0/> evacuate the occupants of the <a1_0>South Tower<a1_0/> and stayed when it collapsed. Within months after the attacks, FBI Director <b7_0>Robert Mueller<b7_0/>, who had been sworn in a week before the attacks, called for a <a2_0>re-engineering<a2_0/> of FBI <a4_0>structure and operations<a4_0/>. He made <a3_0><b8_0>countering every federal crime<b8_0/><a3_0/> a top priority, including the prevention of terrorism, countering foreign intelligence operations, addressing cyber security threats, other high-tech crimes, protecting <b9_0>civil rights<b9_0/>, combating public corruption, organized crime, white-collar crime, and major acts of violent crime.
